lines.text: The KGB is here. I recognize two agents.
The ones dressed as Texans?
No. The ones dressed as Arabs. The ones dressed as Texans are Arab agents. I also recognize two guys from Turkish intelligence.
Which ones? The ones in the Hawaiian shirts?
No, the Bermuda shorts. The ones in the Hawaiian shirts are tourists.
Stupid-ass camel! He'd rather sit there and die!
You know, I kind of admire that.
Me too.
I feel so small when I look at the stars. How big is Venus?
How big is Mars?
I feel so small when I look at the sky. How big is HEAVEEEEN?
How big am I?
Applaud!
[Army table goes nuts]
I'll tell you what I told Tony Bennett. Sing songs people already know. That way they'll still have something to applaud.
Jim, I don't know what you had in mind here, but this mission is no longer covert. We are now overtly firing on two Americans and God knows who else. And they are armed to the teeth!
Either shoot me or lower your voice.
This is an ancient devious world, and you come from a young country. Promise me you will keep my secret without trying to understand it.
The birds in the desert eat only flesh, and there is no wind.
Is this the oasis?
Does this look like an oasis to you?
Yeah, look at the birds. Are those vultures?
Yeah.
You mean they're here on spec?
What a smuck I was...
Schmuck! It's not smuck. Schmuck!
Smuck!

[loud]
Schmuck!
Sssssssssmuck!
Say "ssshhhh"
Ssshhhhhh.
Now say "muck".

[soft]
Muck.
Now say "ssshhh" and "muck" together real fast.
Smuck!
...Closer.
You really know the lingo.

[Shirra is crying at the concert]
What's wrong?
I think they're wonderful.

[Reading a note passed by the waiter]
Oh my God, this guy's a songwriter and he liked my song! He wants to buy me a drink!
Hot fudge love, cherry-ripple kisses. Lip-smacking, back-slappin', perfectly delicious.
I'm quittin' High School, 'cos you don't like me...
The Dome of the Emir's Palace is made of gold. The people have never seen a refridgerator.
Sir? We did NOT fire on two Americans in the desert. We did NOT. Who told you that? The Secretary of State? Well, how would he know?
You mean you bought a camel?
No, I didn't really buy it. They SOLD it to me!
Oh no. I think that something went wrong and now I own a blind camel. A blind camel!
You didn't have to leave with me, now I've spoiled the night for you.
You gotta give yourself a break! You've never been out with anyone but your wife.

Yeah, but you gotta have the looks, Chuck. I mean, you walk into a place like that and girls just want ya, ya know, ya got that kinda face. Kinda mean lookin' but with character. And the way you walk, you can only do that with a small body! Didya ever hear of a big sports car? I mean, if I'd look like you -...
Oh, you so idealize me!

[to Chuck]
It takes a lot of nerve to have nothing at your age, don't you understand that? Most guys'd be ashamed, but you've got the guts to just say 'to hell with it'. You say that you'd rather have nothing than settle for less, understand?
Take one sip at a time. That water has to last you about another 48 minutes.
Why, what happens then?
We run out of water.
The enemy of my enemies is my friend.
Chuck, this isn't really a good time to get depressed.
You're right, I don't know what's wrong with me.
we're not livin' lives of quiet desperation.

[singing]
Telling the truth can be dangerous business; / Honest and popular don't go hand in hand. / If you admit that you play the accordion, / No one will hire you in a rock 'n' roll band. / But we can sing out hearts out. / And if we're lucky, then no neighbors complain. / Because life is the way we audition for God; / Let us pray that we all get the job.
(singing) Because of yourself, you don't know what I am.
What?

[Chuck and Lyle are writing a song]
Shit man, when you're on you're on.

[singing/composing new song]
She said come look there's a... she said come look there's a wardrobe of love in my eyes...
Take your time, look around and see if there's something your size...
Are these breasts?
[thinking he's dealing with a male robber in his hotel room]
He says he will sell you a blind camel. He says he also knows of a camel with a crippled leg and no teeth. Would you like a dead camel?
I am Ahmad bin Ali. I am the Caid of Assari. It was I that called out "Yellow Rose of Texas". Perhaps you would care to entertain at my worthless palace?
No, if two Americans die it has to be unofficially.

I see her standing in the backyard of my mind, she cracks her knuckles and the scab that's on her knee won't go away. I see the woman waiting in her eyes and I can see the love but I can't see the Brooklyn Dodgers in LA.
I'm leaving... some love in my Will. I'm leaving... some love in my Will. My life is nearly over, and time goes by so fast. So I'm going to give you a present, to thank you for the past...
So what do you do?
I'm with the CIA.
Interesting work?
Frankly, you're old, you're white, you got no shtick, you got no gimmicks.
But we're not singers, we're songwriters.
So? The Beach Boys weren't songwriters.
And now, a song dedicated to a lovely lady... of the Left.

[Chuck and Lyle are songwriting at the bar after closing time]
Can't we just have half an hour?
Half an hour? Half an hour like the last half hour?

[to Lyle]
Hey, how about, how about "Give me half an hour like the last half hour"

[Playing furiously]
Give me half an hour!
Like the last half-hour!
Give me half an hour!
Like the last half-hour!
Hello...
Hello...
Baby...
Baby...
Love you...
Love you...
Baby...
Baby...

[Dancing frenetically]
Darlin'! Oh my little darlin'! Where... are-are you?

[Rigid at his microphone]
Hoopa-hoopa-hoopa.
Does the hawk fly?

[Offering Lyle and Chuck some gig possibilities]
I got good news for ya'. I think I can get you a booking. In Honduras - the hotel where the American journalists stay in Honduras. The last act left because they got nervous about the death squads. But there's no danger if you don't drive in the countryside.

[continues]
I also can get you 10 weeks in Morocco at 950 dirhams a week. That's 95 dollars in American money. Unfortunately I can only get you air fare from the Canary Islands...

[They aren't very enthusiastic about this offer]
Well, don't think too long. A lot of acts would KILL for a booking in North Africa!
He's pointing a gun at us!
Will you stop being paranoid?

[they've put a bounty on the singers]
You are a murderer!
So are you. Or do you think a bullet is crueler than what they face now?
You'll never find it! No-one will find it except the two Messengers of God.
A lot of people don't have someone to go out on a ledge for them.
I lived with my mother until I was thirty-two.
Ay-yi-yi-yi-yi-yi-yi-yi-yi, Schmuckit! Mahallah Hutz Boiyah!
What do you say we get this show on the road?
Honduras?
Morocco, it's safer.

[stranded in the desert]
Oh God! We're going to miss our show!
Nothing ever happened to us. And now we're going to die out in the desert shootin' at helicopters.
I have written about our deaths, we will be remembered.
I knew he had hidden it where they would never find it. He was smiling at me!
[Cries]
It was our last secret.
